title: Margaret Atwood interview: ‘My books are all pretty embarrassing’
text:
Margaret Atwood is giving off a palpable sense of relief. Far from hoping that her novel The Testaments would win this year’s Booker Prize, she seems to have been crossing her fingers that it wouldn’t. To share the prize with Bernardine Evaristo seems to be an acceptable compromise.

“To have won it all by myself would have been a double-edged sword, because a lot of people would have said: she has too many prizes already, somebody else less well-known ought to have had a light shone upon them. And I would probably have agreed with them,” she tells me. “But as it is, somebody else is having a light shone on them, and the fact that I am a part of it probably makes that light bigger.”

Atwood has...
description: Margaret Atwood is giving off a palpable sense of relief.
